intro: Rubus horridulus var. hylobius, commonly known as the rough blackberry, is a shrub native to parts of North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark red to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. This species is often found in woodlands and along the edges of forests.
